definitions.definition: Caused by an agent that enters the host's body (such as a bacterium , virus , parasite , or prion ); often, also, transmitted among hosts via any of various routes (for example, contact, droplet-borne, airborne, waterborne, foodborne, fomite -borne, or bloodborne).
examples: More infectious diseases like the flu are usually less potent.

definitions.definition: Able to infect others; capable of transmitting pathogens.
examples: Despite feeling better, the patient is still infectious .

definitions.definition: Spreading quickly from one person to another.
examples: Her enthusiasm for work can be really infectious .

definitions.definition: Memorable and invoking excitement or interest .
examples: Pop music is more infectious than elevator music.

main_definition: ( pathology , of an illness ) Caused by an agent that enters the host's body (such as a bacterium , virus , parasite , or prion ); often, also, transmitted among hosts via any of various routes (for example, contact, droplet-borne, airborne, waterborne, foodborne, fomite -borne, or bloodborne).
secondary_definitions: ( pathology , typically of a person ) Able to infect others; capable of transmitting pathogens.
( of feelings and behaviour ) Spreading quickly from one person to another.
( informal ) Memorable and invoking excitement or interest .
